segments.text: I notice the water overflowing, and it makes me so sad to see the mess it’s making.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how much work it’s going to take to clean all this up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is about to fall, and it breaks my heart to see him so close to danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for a cookie, and she doesn’t even realize how bad this could end.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this is one of those moments where everything just goes wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is ruining the cabinets, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s plate is shaking, and I can see him losing his balance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how much trouble they’re all in and it just makes me feel worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just so unfortunate, I can’t look away.
segments.speaker: PAR
